de.must.dataobj
Class IdentifyTemplate

java.lang.Object
  de.must.dataobj.IdentifyTemplate

public class IdentifyTemplate
extends java.lang.Object

A template how to identify a database entry.

Identifier, DataObject

public IdentifyTemplate(java.lang.String[] identifyColumnNames,
                        int[] columnTypes)
Constructs a identification template.

Parameters:
identifyColumnNames - the names of the columns to be used as primary key
columnTypes - the types of the columns to be used as primary key

getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements

public java.lang.String getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements()
Returns the identify condition for prepared statements, e.g. where keyfield1 = ? and keyfield2 = ?

Returns:
the identify condition for prepared statements

setIdentifier

public void setIdentifier(java.sql.PreparedStatement ps,
                          Identifier ident,
                          int[] lengths)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Sets the identifying fields to get a unique row by using prepared statements. Use getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements to get the where condition part of the prepared statement query.

Parameters:
ps - the prepared statement to use
ident - the identifier to identify the wished row
lengths - the length of identifier fields to fill them with spaces if they are defined as char
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements()

setIdentifier

public void setIdentifier(java.sql.PreparedStatement ps,
                          Identifier ident,
                          int[] lengths,
                          int columnOffset)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Sets the identifying fields to get a unique row by using prepared statements. Use getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements to get the where condition part of the prepared statement query.

Parameters:
ps - the prepared statement to use
ident - the identifier to identify the wished row
lengths - the length of identifier fields to fill them with spaces if they are defined as char
columnOffset - the offset of the key columns / the number of fields used in the prepared statements before the where condition fields
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
getIdentifyConditionForPreparedStatements()
